rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C99074

definition: CDISC terminology for anatomical location or specimen further detailing directionality.
name: Directionality

terms.definition: Denoting the front portion of the body or a structure.
Denoting the area of the body in front of and away from the middle line.
Denoting the front portion of the body towards the median plane.
Directed from front to back.
Denoting the front portion of the body toward the temple.
Relating to or located at the apex.
Relating to or located at the lowest portion of a structure.
Toward the tail in a body.
A point or area that is approximately central within some larger region or structure. (NCI)
Toward the head in a body.
Pertaining to an anatomical plane extending between the cranial (towards the head) and caudal (towards the tail) portions of a body.
Extending relatively far inward. (NCI)
Pertaining to the farthest portion from the palm side of a hand or the sole side of a foot.
Situated farthest from a point of reference.
Pertaining to the back or upper surface of the body.
Toward the back and side of a body.
Of, or related to, or in the direction of the face. (NCI)
Of or involving the front of a main body. (NCI)
Of, or related to, or in the direction of the front of the body, structure, or object. (NCI)
Of or involving the back of a main body. (NCI)
Pertaining to a point below a given reference point.
Inside or closer to the inside of the body or object. (NCI)
Located between two points or extremes.
Situated at or extending to the side.
Pertaining to the lower portion of the surface on the opposite side of the joint when it bends.
Pertaining to the lower portion of the surface on the same side of the joint when it bends.
Denoting the lower portion of the body towards the median plane.
The bottom one of two. (NCI)
Toward the middle or in a limb toward the median plane.
A medial line, especially the medial line or medial plane of the body (or some part of the body).
Of, or related to, or in the direction of the nose.
Of, or related to, or in the direction of the occiput, or back of the head. (NCI)
Being on or toward the outside of the body or object. (NCI)
Of, or related to, the area of the body where the parietal and occipital lobes of the brain meet.
On or near an edge or constituting an outer boundary; the outer area. (NCI)
Of, or pertaining to, the area surrounding the ventricles of the brain.
Denoting the back portion of the body or a structure.
Pertaining to the nearest portion from the palm side of a hand or the sole side of a foot.
Situated nearest to a point of reference.
Toward the muzzle in the head.
Of, or related to, or in the direction of, an anatomical septum.
Denoting the area below a cortex.
Of or pertaining to the exterior surface. (NCI)
Pertaining to a point above a given reference point.
The extended two-dimensional outer layer or area of a three-dimensional object. (NCI)
Of, or related to, or in the direction of the anatomic sites that are located in the temple.
The pointed end of a structure.
Pertaining to the upper portion of the surface on the opposite side of the joint when it bends.
Pertaining to the upper portion of the surface on the same side of the joint when it bends.
The top one of two.
Pertaining to the front or lower surface of the body.
Of or pertaining to the front and side of a main body. (NCI)
Pertaining to the palm side of a hand or the sole side of a foot.
